DataElement.preferredName: Malignant Neoplasm Sum Diameter Size Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The calculated sum of the diameters (longest for non-nodal lesions, short axis for nodal lesions) of a tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas._The final aggregate amount._The length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle or sphere and connecting two points on the circumference.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: Sum; the final aggregate amount.:Diameter; the length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle and connecting two points on the circumference.

Concepts.definition: The length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle or sphere and connecting two points on the circumference.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements, including linear dimensions, volume, and weight, of a patient's tumor.

DataElementConcept.origin: RECISTv1.1:Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors v1.1

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The physical magnitude of something._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The physical magnitude of something.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ReferenceDocuments.description: The size of the largest tumor in millimeters:
